column1: 29 September 1969##Near Tulbagh#6.3##The 1969 earthquake remains the most destructive earthquake in South African history. The earthquake occurred in the Tulbagh area and measured 6.3 on the Richter scale
column2: stronger than that of the 1809 Cape Town earthquake which destroyed a local Milnerton farm.
North West#5.3##Two miners were killed underground.

column1: 28 May 2013##Near Mbabane#4.0##The earthquake was felt in Newcastle and lasted about six seconds.
